channel.title: Posts on SOC 301 - Spring 2017
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on SOC 301 - Spring 2017

item.title: Week 05 - Tuesday
item.description:
Slides available here

Covered Content

  • Take Quiz #2 from last semester as a class using Plickers
  • Review Chapters 3 and 4 of ModernDive
  • Work on Practice Problems for Quiz #2 in groups

To do for next time

  • Study for Quiz #2 covering Chapters 3 and 4 of ModernDive and the corresponding chapters on DataCamp (Tidy Data through ggplot2 Review)
  • Complete ggplot2 Review DataCamp chapter (Due on March 2 at 1 PM)
  • Begin Working with the RStudio IDE (Part 1) - Orientation chapter on DataCamp (Due on March ) (Due on March 7 at 1 PM)
    • This will require you to download R and RStudio Desktop to your laptop computer. The sooner you do this the better. If you have issues, please reach out to me AS SOON AS POSSIBLE!

item.title: Week 04 - Thursday
item.description:
Slides available here

Covered Content

  • Review histograms and boxplots
  • Review the library function and the ggplot2 template
  • Go over Grammar of Graphics with examples of
    • barplot
    • stacked barplot
    • side-by-side barplot
    • faceted barplot
    • stacked proportional barplot
  • Finish Problem Set 4 in groups

To do for next time

  • Re-read and take notes on all of Chapters 3 and 4 of ModernDive
    • Work on Problem Set 5.
  • Study for Quiz #2 covering Chapters 3 and 4 of ModernDive and the corresponding chapters on DataCamp (Tidy Data through ggplot2 Review)
  • Complete Barplots DataCamp chapter (Due on February 28 at 1 PM)
  • Begin ggplot2 Review DataCamp chapter (Due on March 2 at 1 PM)

item.title: Week 04 - Tuesday
item.description:
Slides available here

Covered Content

  • Review scatterplots
  • Go over Grammar of Graphics with histogram, faceted histogram, and boxplot examples
  • Work on Problem Set 4 in groups

To do for next time

  • Complete DataCamp profile
    • Click on your user ID in the top right of the screen when you first open DataCamp.
    • Click on My Profile.
    • Select Edit Account Settings.
    • Input at the very least your first and last name. More helpful if you include a picture.
  • Read and take notes on Section 4.8 of ModernDive
    • Work on Problem Set 4 corresponding to those sections.
  • Complete Histograms & Boxplots DataCamp chapter (Due on February 23 at 1 PM)
  • Begin Barplots DataCamp chapter (Due on February 28 at 1 PM)

item.title: Week 03 - Thursday
item.description:
Slides available here

Covered Content

  • Review the concept of joining data frames
  • Go over Grammar of Graphics with scatter-plot and line-graph examples
  • Work on and finish Problem Set 3 in groups

To do for next time

  • Complete DataCamp profile
    • Click on your user ID in the top right of the screen when you first open DataCamp.
    • Click on My Profile.
    • Select Edit Account Settings.
    • Input at the very least your first and last name. More helpful if you include a picture.
  • Take notes on Sections 4.5 to 4.7 of ModernDive
    • Work on Problem Set 4 corresponding to those sections.
  • Complete Scatter-plots & Line-graphs DataCamp chapter (Due on February 21 at 1 PM)
  • Begin Histograms & Boxplots DataCamp chapter (Due on February 23 at 1 PM)

item.title: Week 03 - Tuesday
item.description:
Slides available here

Covered Content

  • Review the concept of tidy data
    • Plicker questions here
  • Discuss joining data frames by a common key variable
  • Work on Problem Set 3 in groups

To do for next time

  • Complete DataCamp profile
  • Take notes on Chapter 4 of ModernDive
  • Complete Tidy Data DataCamp chapter (Due on February 16 at 1 PM)
  • Begin Scatter-plots & Line-graphs DataCamp chapter (Due on February 21 at 1 PM)

item.title: Week 02 - Thursday
item.description:
Slides available here

Covered Content

  • Quiz #1 (Individual and Group)
  • Go over the concept of tidy data
  • Finish Problem Set 2 in groups

To do for next time

  • Review the Learning Strategies given here and commit to using them to succeed in learning
  • Complete DataCamp profile
  • Take notes on Chapter 3 of ModernDive
  • Complete Applying R Basics DataCamp chapter (Due on February 14 at 1 PM)
  • Begin Tidy Data DataCamp chapter (Due on February 16 at 1 PM)

item.title: Week 02 - Tuesday
item.description:
Slides available here

Covered Content

  • Discuss why we are using R
  • Go over the basics of R with a diagram on the chalkboard
  • Watch videos on study strategies
  • Take the multiple choice problems your fellow students have created

To do for next time

  • Study for Quiz #1 using the strategies laid out over the Introduction to R DataCamp course on Thursday, February 9
  • Review the Learning Strategies given here and commit to using them to succeed in learning
  • Complete DataCamp profile
  • Read Chapter 3 of ModernDive
    • As you read attempt the Learning Checks for understanding
  • Begin work on Applying R Basics DataCamp chapter (Due on February 14 at 1 PM)

item.title: Week 01 - Thursday
item.description:
Slides available here

Covered Content

  • Finish discussing study strategies from Tuesday
  • Complete Introduction to R DataCamp course

To do for next time

  • Carefully read over the syllabus in entirety
  • Make note of important dates on the schedule
  • Read Chapters 1 and 2 of ModernDive
  • Write down AT LEAST five multiple choice questions covering the Introduction to R DataCamp course.
    • Each question should have four possible answers.
    • Create questions based on the content you struggled with most.
  • Finish the Introduction to R DataCamp course
    • Needs to be completed by 1 PM Pacific on Tuesday, February 7
    • If you have spent more than 30 minutes on a problem, move on to another one OR reach out for help.
    • If completed, start working on Applying R Basics chapter in my Effective Data Storytelling via the tidyverse course (Due Tuesday, February 14)

item.title: Week 01 - Tuesday
item.description:
Slides available here

Covered Content

  • Introduction to the course and to each other

To do for next time

  • Carefully read over the syllabus in entirety
  • Make note of important dates on the schedule
  • Read the first two chapters of ModernDive for Thursday
  • Get signed up for Slack and download to your computer and/or mobile device
  • Start working on Introduction to R DataCamp course as soon as possible!

item.title: Welcome to SOC 301!
item.description:
You will find links to the content covered in each class period in posts made to the main page that you just came from at http://ismayc.github.io/soc301-s2017. You can also return to the homepage at any time by clicking on the Boxer image in the top left of the page. Note that this webpage and (hopefully) all of its content will also work on mobile devices too.

Maybe the most important document here is the Syllabus. You can find the current version (and any future updates to it) by clicking on the Syllabus link at the top of this page.

You can find links to DataCamp assignments throughout the course via the DataCamp link above. The Problem Sets link provides you with reading assignments and problems that we will be working on in class and reviewing. You are encouraged to work through as many of the Learning checks as you can as you read the course textbook at http://moderndive.com.

I’m looking forward to helping you learn about Social Statistics and program in R this semester! You will also find great information in the Resources page available in the top right as well. Please be sure to frequently review the Tips to Success for the course on a frequent basis that is in Resources. I’m providing you with exactly what you need to do well and learn (and retain) the content of the course. Don’t miss out!
